analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: yang mi la la zhig gis mkhar gang ba'i gser dngul khyer te sbyar bar byas pas mi des chos kyi yi ge bshad zin nas de'i tshe dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / phal sde bzhin kun shin tu dga' ste /
analyzed: yang mi la la zhig gis mkhar gang ba'i gser dngul khyer te sbyar bar byas pas mi des chos kyi yi ge bshad zin nas de'i tshe dga' bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / phal sde bzhin kun shin tu dga' ste /
translated: Again, some people took gold and silver equal to the value of the land and offered it to him. After the man had explained the Dharma texts, at that time Nanda, the Bodhisattva, and the ordinary people were all very happy.

original: sems kyis yang dag pa'i mir gyur pa thob nas sangs rgyas kyi zhabs la spyi bos phyag btsal te dga' nas gus par spyod do //

translated: Having attained the state of a true person with the mind, they bowed their heads to the Buddha's feet and respectfully practiced with joy.

original: rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi chos kyi yi ge rdzogs so ////
